column1: NAME        Isoflavonoid biosynthesis - Lactuca sativa (garden lettuce)
DESCRIPTION Isoflavonoids are biologically active compounds
column3: produced by pea family plants. While flavonoids (in the narrow sense) have the 2-phenylchromen-4-one backbone
column4: isoflavonoids have the 3-phenylchromen-4-one backbone with no hydroxyl group substitution at position 2. Isoflavonoids are derived from the flavonoid biosynthesis pathway via liquiritigenin or naringenin.

column1: CLASS       Metabolism; Biosynthesis of other secondary metabolites
